t: Proverbs 29
He*pn who is often rebuked, and*i hardens his*i neck, Will*ld suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
When*ln the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice; But*ld when a wicked man*i rules, the people groan.
Whoever*ln loves wisdom makes his father rejoice, But*ld a companion of harlots wastes his*i wealth.
The*ln king establishes the land by justice, But*ld he who receives bribes overthrows it.
A*ln man who flatters his neighbor Spreads*ld a net for his feet.
By*ln transgression an evil man is snared, But*ld the righteous sings and rejoices.
The*ln righteous considers the cause of the poor, But*ild the wicked does not understand such*i knowledge.
Scoffers*ln set a city aflame, But*ld wise men*i turn away wrath.
If*iln a wise man contends with a foolish man, Whether*ld the*i fool*i rages or laughs, there*i is*i no peace.
The*ln bloodthirsty hate the blameless, But*ld the upright seek his well-being.
A*ln fool vents all his feelings, But*ld a wise man*i holds them back.
If*ln a ruler pays attention to lies, All*ld his servants become*i wicked.
The*ln poor man*i and the oppressor have this in common: The*ld Lord*s gives light to the eyes of both.
The*ln king who judges the poor with truth, His*ld throne will be established forever.
The*ln rod and rebuke give wisdom, But*ld a child left to*i himself*i brings shame to his mother.
When*ln the wicked are multiplied, transgression increases; But*ld the righteous will see their fall.
Correct*ln your son, and he will give you rest; Yes,*ld he will give delight to your soul.
Where*ln there*i is*i no revelation, the people cast off restraint; But*ld happy is*i he who keeps the law.
A*ln servant will not be corrected by mere words; For*ld though he understands, he will not respond.
Do*ln you see a man hasty in his words? There*ild is*i more hope for a fool than for him.
He*ln who pampers his servant from childhood Will*ld have him as a son in the end.
An*ln angry man stirs up strife, And*ld a furious man abounds in transgression.
A*ln man’s pride will bring him low, But*ld the humble in spirit will retain honor.
Whoever*ln is a partner with a thief hates his own life; He*ld swears to tell the truth, but reveals nothing.
The*ln fear of man brings a snare, But*ld whoever trusts in the Lord*s shall be safe.
Many*ln seek the ruler’s favor, But*ld justice for man comes*i from the Lord.*s
An*ln unjust man is*i an abomination to the righteous, And*ld he*i who*i is*i upright in the way is*i an abomination to the wicked.
